body_html:
I guess the change that broke it is:
BUILD_COMMAND ${CMAKE_COMMAND} --build . --config Release --target grpc++_unsecure
and we could use $(Configuration) .
There is also -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE:STRING=Release passed to the grpc cmake but assume that is never looked at,, else this this would have been broken in past.
Either way is fine with me - your pick.
@mrry - any preference ?

A little upside for rpc Release builds only: for gpu builds there is an issue that the total size of the symbols info of the python_wrapper.dll is > 4GB which hits some limit in link.exe (it fails) ... less symbols is a good thing.
body_text:
I guess the change that broke it is:
BUILD_COMMAND ${CMAKE_COMMAND} --build . --config Release --target grpc++_unsecure
and we could use  $(Configuration) .
There is also -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE:STRING=Release passed to the grpc cmake but assume that is never looked at,, else this this would have been broken in past.
Either way is fine with me - your pick.
@mrry  - any preference ?
A little upside for rpc Release builds only: for gpu builds there is an issue that the total size of the symbols info of the python_wrapper.dll is > 4GB which hits some limit in link.exe (it fails) ... less symbols is a good thing.
body:
I guess the change that broke it is:
BUILD_COMMAND ${CMAKE_COMMAND} --build . --config **Release** --target grpc++_unsecure
and we could use  $(Configuration) .
There is also -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE:STRING=Release passed to the grpc cmake but assume that is never looked at,, else this this would have been broken in past.
Either way is fine with me - your pick.
@mrry  - any preference ?

A little upside for rpc Release builds only: for gpu builds there is an issue that the total size of the symbols info of the python_wrapper.dll is > 4GB which hits some limit in link.exe (it fails) ... less symbols is a good thing.
